FuncDef:
The ptp alarm-threshold standard-time-offset command configures an alarm threshold for the PTP source absolute time reference.
The undo ptp alarm-threshold standard-time-offset command restores the default configuration.
By default, the alarm threshold for the PTP source absolute time reference is 500 ns.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the alarm threshold for the PTP source absolute time reference.
The value is an integer that ranges from 200 to 1000, in ns.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a device can obtain the absolute time reference source through an external BITS clock source, the device can compare the external reference time and PTP time and reports the time difference. If the time difference exceeds the threshold, an alarm will be reported. To configure the alarm threshold for the difference between the eternal reference time and PTP time, run the ptp alarm-threshold standard-time-offset command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
